verses.verse: Then Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you say <S%H4448><s%> these <S%H428><s%> [things,] And the words <S%H561><s%> of your mouth <S%H6310><s%> be a mighty <S%H3524><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%>?
"Does God <S%H410><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> justice <S%H4941><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> does the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> what <S%H6664><s%> is right <S%H6664><s%>?
"If <S%H518><s%> your sons <S%H1121><s%> sinned <S%H2398><s%> against Him, Then He delivered <S%H7971><s%> them into the power <S%H3027><s%> of their transgression. <S%H6588><s%>
"If <S%H518><s%> you would seek <S%H7836><s%> God <S%H410><s%> And implore <S%H2603><s%> the compassion <S%H2603><s%> of the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you are pure <S%H2134><s%> and upright, <S%H3477><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> He would rouse <S%H5782><s%> Himself for you And restore <S%H9608><s%> your righteous <S%H6664><s%> estate. <S%H5116><s%>
"Though your beginning <S%H7225><s%> was insignificant, <S%H4705><s%> Yet your end <S%H319><s%> will increase <S%H7685><s%> greatly. <S%H3966><s%>
"Please <S%H4994><s%> inquire <S%H7592><s%> of past <S%H7223><s%> generations, <S%H1755><s%> And consider <S%H3559><s%> the things <S%H2714><s%> searched <S%H2714><s%> out by their fathers.
"For we are [only] of yesterday <S%H8543><s%> and know <S%H3045><s%> nothing, <S%H3808><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> our days <S%H3117><s%> on earth <S%H776><s%> are as a shadow. <S%H6738><s%>
"Will they not teach <S%H3384><s%> you [and] tell <S%H559><s%> you, And bring <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> words <S%H4405><s%> from their minds <S%H3820><s%>?
"Can the papyrus <S%H1573><s%> grow <S%H1342><s%> up without <S%H3808><s%> marsh <S%H1207><s%>? Can the rushes <S%H260><s%> grow <S%H7685><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>?
"While it is still <S%H5750><s%> green [and] not cut <S%H3><s%> down, <S%H6998><s%> Yet it withers <S%H6998><s%> before <S%H3001><s%> any <S%H6440><s%> [other] plant. <S%H3605><s%>
"So <S%H3651><s%> are the paths <S%H734><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H7911><s%> forget <S%H7911><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> And the hope <S%H8615><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%> will perish,
Whose <S%H834><s%> confidence <S%H3689><s%> is fragile, <S%H9511><s%> And whose trust <S%H4009><s%> a spider's web. <S%H1004><s%>
"He trusts <S%H8172><s%> in his house, <S%H1004><s%> but it does not stand; <S%H5975><s%> He holds <S%H2388><s%> fast <S%H2388><s%> to it, but it does not endure. <S%H6965><s%>
"He thrives <S%H7373><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> And his shoots <S%H3127><s%> spread <S%H3318><s%> out over <S%H5921><s%> his garden. <S%H1593><s%>
"His roots <S%H8328><s%> wrap <S%H5440><s%> around <S%H5440><s%> a rock <S%H1530><s%> pile, <S%H1530><s%> He grasps <S%H270><s%> a house <S%H1004><s%> of stones. <S%H68><s%>
"If <S%H518><s%> he is removed <S%H1104><s%> from his place, <S%H4725><s%> Then it will deny <S%H3584><s%> him, [saying,] 'I never <S%H3808><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> you.'
"Behold, <S%H2005><s%> this <S%H1931><s%> is the joy <S%H4885><s%> of His way; <S%H1870><s%> And out of the dust <S%H6083><s%> others <S%H312><s%> will spring. <S%H6779><s%>
"Lo, <S%H2005><s%> God <S%H410><s%> will not reject <S%H3988><s%> [a man of] integrity, <S%H8535><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> will He support <S%H2388><s%> <S%H3027><s%> the evildoers. <S%H7489><s%>
"He will yet <S%H5704><s%> fill <S%H4390><s%> your mouth <S%H6310><s%> with laughter, <S%H7814><s%> And your lips <S%H8193><s%> with shouting. <S%H8643><s%>
"Those who hate <S%H8130><s%> you will be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame; <S%H1322><s%> And the tent <S%H168><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> will be no <S%H369><s%> more."
